bug.description:
/kind feature We need to guarantee kubeflow Multi-Tenancy Compatibility with different environments:
Always create default profile Istio rbac is only ON when coming requests contains identity which is accepted by both Istio and k8s. Notebook spawner should not block user creating notebooks when Istio rbac is OFF Test for on prem environment; document how to setup Multi-Tenancy on prem.

Notebook spawner should not block user creating notebooks when Istio rbac is OFF
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link> could you elaborate a little bit more on this one? What's the use case that the jupyter webapp blocks the user from creating a Notebook?

Here's a table I think listing the use cases we want to test
How Installed ISTIO Identity Aware Profile Created Automatically
kfctl_k8s_existing yam No No
kfctl_k8s_existing_arrikto.yaml ? No
kfctl_gcp_iap.yam yes yes
In all of the above cases we want to verify the following works
If profile isn't created automatically; create one via kfctl User goes to jupyter web app and sees namespaces for which they have access (e.g. profile created) User creates notebook User can connect to notebook
So we want to support two cases;
ISTIO is aware of the user's identity; because requests have a header/JWT identifying the user ISTIO isn't aware of the identity (e.g. because no identity headers are added as in kfctl_k8s_existing.yaml)
In the case where ISTIO isn't identity aware we need to ensure ISTIO RBAC isn't configured so that users would be blocked from accessing their notebook. When we are using DEX (kfctl_existing_arrikto.yaml) we should be able to make ISTIO aware of the user's identity. In the short term though; that may not work because we still have to fix some issues in order to use the DEX added identity headers. At the very least though we should be able to fall back to the situation where ISTIO is not identity aware which would achieve parity with current behavior.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> the existing_arrikto config using Dex is capable of identity awareness. In order to do that, this issue needs to be resolved first: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3553>#3553</denchmark-link>
The packages of some applications in manifests have to be extended to make the userid header customizable. Right now, it is set to x-goog-authenticated-user-email by default. I will try to tackle this issue today, as it should be in this release.
